title: Folder not appearing in Folder Panel
content: I imported my profile from a PC to a MacBook Air and it went quite well. However, one of the mail folders that I can see in my new profile on the MacBook is not appearing on the Folder Pane when I open Thunderbird. It's part of my Local Folders so I tried to add a folder of the same name and it told me that there was already a folder by that name. So it's definitely there but just inaccessible through the Folder Pane. Is there a magic way to get all folders to show up?

title: Problems with Thunderbird
content: Earlier this evening, I restarted my Mac computer, and inexplicably found that all of my email sub-folders had mysteriously disappeared. I eventually made a donation to Mozilla in order to hopefully reinstall this program in a desperate attempt recover all of these files, but have still made no progress. Please, please help me to recover this information. Thank you in advance for any help you can offer.

title: Fresh install Ubuntu 24.04: thunderbird cannot send emails anymore
content:
Hi,

I have been using Thunderbird happily for a long time, most recently version 115.13.0 on my Ubuntu 22.04 partition. Recently I installed Ubuntu 24.04 on another partition, including Thunderbird 128.0esr, now installed as a snap package (it's a recent change in Ubuntu; instead of apt package previously).

The new Thunderbird correctly reads my emails (imap) but it cannot send emails, save drafts or mark emails as read on the server. So I have Thunderbird 115 on the old partition working perfectly, but Thunderbird 128 not working on the same GMail account (I also have the same problem with another non-GMail account). I checked the smtp settings carefully, they are identical between the two versions.

It's possible I made a mistake, but I'm at a loss about what is wrong. How can I diagnose and solve this problem?

(I know that I could reinstall Thunderbird with the apt package, but I assume that the snap package should work too and I would like to understand the cause)

I'd be grateful for any advice
creator: erwan.more

title: Tbird 115.10.1 crashing in garbage collect
content:
See 7a70ec71-3686-4468-8647-4d6da0240727. This seems to be a recent and persistent issue. I've rebuilt the global index and several mailboxes. Activity Manager shows a real drop in the performance of indexing a mailbox (it gets slower and slower), eventually resulting in a crash.

Side note: the message "Indexing {X} of {Y} messages in {folder_name}..." would be infinitely more helpful if the message also mentioned which account that folder was in.
creator: firefox.sync.osn4wd

title: Adding "From Addresses" (rather than just the forced default address)
content:
I use Thunderbird Nebula to access my Protonmail account. In Protonmail, I have over 20 aliases for my email address. (Each address comes into my main mail box.) When I use my Protonmail account on a webpage, I can change the "From address" to be any of my 20 aliases when I reply to or forward an email.

However, when I use Thunderbird to access my Protonmail, it only allows me to forward email from my default address, not my aliases.

This is a deal breaker for me because I must be able to send email from any of my aliases.

When I try to forward from a different custom from address, I get a message that it is possible, to send from different addresses, but I cannot find any directions online or in forums or in help or in the menus. Can anyone help me, please?


Customize From Address
creator: 321tech

title: Formatting new mails
content: Is it possible to define user-defined formatting characteristics when creating a message and to save them permanently for each new mail created? In particular, I would like to be able to user-define the line spacing at the top and bottom (i.e. the line height ) and, if possible, also the other formatting parameters (such as font, font size, font attrbutes and so on) in different paragraphs and save them permanently for new mails. The existing option ‘Paragraph’ via the menu items Format - Paragraph - Paragraph does not offer this possibility according to my tests. Is there such a possibility in Thunderbird? Many greetings from Germany
creator: uwebaste

title: Desktop notification when a new mail arrives only for SOME accounts
content:
Hello,

sorry if this has been asked before. I have Thunderbird on Linux Mint at work, configured with work account, of course, and several others. How can I make Thunderbird show desktop notification when mail arrives ONLY for one account, and not for others. I tried clicking through settings, at it seems to me that I can configure notifications for all accounts or no notifications at all.

One of the usages of using a mail client is to have multiple accounts in the same program, and I hate webmail / am old school, but I hate it when my coworker sits with me in front of my screen, and suddenly a LinkedIn job offer from my personal account pops up in desktop notifications.

Again, sorry if I didn't read through everything, another problem is that the UI keeps changing alot, so setting aren't where they used to be... Is it possible in an easy way to do what I want?

Thanks, Davor
creator: dbeuc

title: Thunderbird freezes when deleting mail in inbox
content: I have three accounts in Thunderbird. On one account Thunderbird freezes when I try to delete any mail in the inbox. I have removed all mails in the inbox and put one mail back (have tried several different emails)to test and it still freezes. This problem occurs when deleting from any folder in this account. Deleting mail in the other accounts works ok.

title: Last 12 days of emails have disappeared from inbox.
content: In the course of my work I was scrolling back and forth through the emails in my inbox when I suddenly could not scroll any later than 12 days before the present date. I can scroll through emails previous to that normally. I then sent a test email to this account from a different account and it was received and displayed correct. So I am unable to access any emails between 12 days ago and now, like something took a bite out of my emails.

title: Abuse of my identity - friends on my address list receiving emails purporting to be from me but which are not
content: Twice recently friends have reported to me that they have received emails purporting to be from my email address and these are not from me. So scammers have somehow been able to access my address book, know my address and send false messages. What can I do to prevent this?
creator: m.routledge

title: Dissapearing Email
content:
I did a search for disappearing email and saw many instances of this and although I read through the solutions, I don't know if any apply to me so I am asking about it.

I received a payment on 7/6 from a client. It was a Zelle payment notification from my bank.

Yesterday the same client sent the same payment. When I downloaded the mails from over night, I saw the new payment notification. However I wanted to move the email from the Inbox to a Sales folder just as I had done 20 days ago with the previous payment.

I then opened the Sales folder and the mail wasn't there. I did a whole system search by the sender and the subject and all it found was the 7/6 mail. The 7/26 mail is gone, as if it was a hallucination.

Since I knew I got the mail, and so I know I got paid, but it bothers me that other mails are being lost as well.

I am running Windows 10 and my Tbird shows "up to date". I am running Malwarebytes which allowed the first message through as it did this time. I can't fathom how a mail can disappear just moving it from one folder to another.

Help please!
creator: lew3
